definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: His eyes were fixed on the magazine rack next to the cash register.
sentences.chinese: 他的眼睛盯着收银台下的杂志架。

sentences.english: No wonder you do not see long queues at the tills in many of the shops here.
sentences.chinese: 难怪在许多店里都看不到收银台前排长龙的情形。

sentences.english: Your attention please. Would the parent of Chloe Sanders please go to Cash Register 7 3) immediately .
sentences.chinese: 请注意，可儿山德斯的家长请即刻前往七号收银台。

sentences.english: Help bag your own groceries at the checkout counter.
sentences.chinese: 在杂货店的收银台买单时帮忙打包自己的东西。

sentences.english: Skinner knows the restaurants are the only place the cash register rings.
sentences.chinese: 斯金纳知道餐厅是唯一的收银台铃响的地方。

sentences.english: S9: Here is the bill. Please pay the cashier.
sentences.chinese: 这是账单，请到收银台付款。

sentences.english: The supermarket checkout woman addressed her daughter with “Hi, Princess.
sentences.chinese: 超市收银台的服务员会喊她的女儿“嘿，小公主。”

sentences.english: Standing in "line" at the registers took more patience than surely even Buddha had cultivated.
sentences.chinese: 收银台的排队甚至比潜心修佛还要更大的耐心。

definition: variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結賬|结账
supermarket/abbr. for 超級市場|超级市场/CL:家[jia1]
(at a restaurant) to order a meal/(of a waiter) to take an order
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
